text: The Naples National Archaeological Museum (Museo Archeologico Nazionale di Napoli, MANN) is a museum in Naples. The museum has a large display of Roman artifacts from Pompeii, Stabiae and Herculaneum. The display has works made in Greek, Roman and Renaissance times. It is known as the most important Italian archaeological museum. ==Building== Charles III of Spain started the museum in the 1750s. The building was used to house soldiers in the 18th century. == References == == Other websites == * http://www.museoarcheologiconapoli.it/it/ Official website - Naples National Archaeological Museum Category:Art museums in Italy Category:Naples Category:1750s establishments in Europe Category:18th-century establishments in Italy
title: National Archaeological Museum, Naples
